rComments: If you're not an Arabic speaker or struggle with the alphabet after the first class, get ready to read aloud in front of EVERYONE. The teacher is harsh and unless you involve the department in your request, they won't respect your requests. If you wait for the last class of the chapter to read your mic will get unmuted without your accord. Avoid.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Her expectations are too high for students in this class. This class is for beginners, but most people who are in the class already speak Arabic, and she bases her expectations on the students who are fluent telling the people who are actually trying to learn the language that they are unprepared. Also extremely difficult to contact.

She is genuinely one of the most caring professor out there. She might seem tough and very specific when it comes to a lot of things (writing style, pronunciation, participation), but that's because she wants you to actually learn the right way. She really makes you WORK for your grade, but gives excellent feedback so you could succeed and improve

Best prof if you actually want to learn the language, maybe not the best option in terms of easy A+. Although in my opinion it was still a very easy A+ if you listen in class. I made a lot of mistakes on my first homework, she still gave an 8/10 and then I learned from my mistake and got 100 or close to that on every homeowork/assignment/midterm.

If you don't already speak Arabic, this prof ain't it. Expects you to speak and write like you're already fluent even though this is just a beginner's class. Most of the people who take this class already speak Arabic so she bases her expectations on the fact that everyone else knows the basics already.

If you're a beginner and want to learn Arabic this is the teacher. She's old school and wants you to come to all classes. But I find that it is what helped me to keep my interest in class and the discipline. Outside of class she's very nice and helpful. If you have problems with Arabic, talk to her and she'll help.

Reminds me of my primary school teachers in the way that she speaks very loud and very slow when explaining things. May seem like a good thing for elementary arabic, but trust me it doesn't translate well irl. Very boring lecturer but ok if there's no alternative. Try to avoid as a first option but don't feel scared if you end up with her.

This prof acts as if we already know how to speak arabic fluently.. It's a beginner's class? I wouldn't recommend this class if you have no knowledge of this language, you simply won't do well. Also her vocab test are really hard so prepare yourself to memorise words with letters you haven't learned yet. Do not take, period.

Overall she is okay, she does well to clearly explain the material. She is a very tough grader and pretty unforgiving for a prof. of a beginner level Arabic class. She will test you on things vocab words that are you don't know the letters for, which will test your ability to memorize more than actually know spelling. Not available outside of class

Overall she is okay, she does well to clearly explain the material. She is a very tough grader and pretty unforgiving for a prof. of a beginner level Arabic class. Disclaimer: she will test you on things vocab words that are you don't know the letters for, which will test your ability to memorize more than actually know spelling.

Mme. Claude El-Khoury est une enseignante qui inspire ses éleves a viser plus haut dans tout ce qu'ils font. Elle a confiance en la réussite de ses éleves et s'engage a fond dans leur réussite. C'est une main de fer dans un gant de velour. Elle peut avoir l'air fâché lorsqu'on ne réussit pas, mais c'est pcq qu'on peut faire mieux and she knows it.
Awesome teacher, learned a lot in her class. She hates people who talk during class so be quiet. Lots of work but everything is to prepare you for future tests or vocab test.

There's A LOT of work to do, it takes a lot of time outside of class. Good teacher but she's really strict. It's not an easy class and I wouldn't recommend you to take ARB1911 if you don't really have the motivation.
There is assignments/dictations due every class. The content of the class is okay and she is a good teacher but sometimes she expects you to understand things quickly.

I loved that teacher she is simply amazing. If you need help on anything she is always available outside of class plus she repeats a lot in class to make sure everybody understands. She gives homework that are very easy if you take the time to do them it's basically your study for the exam. The class is very interesting and dynamic!

ARB1911 isn't hard regarding content but very hard regarding workload. There is homework due every class and a test/dictation every week. Even so I really liked this class and the somewhat strict prof. If you just do your hw and practice a bit outside of class, then it's pretty easy. Just make sure not to talk in her class and you will do fine :)

Homework due nearly every class. Time commitment is higher than expected, but it's fairly easy to do well on them. The professor isn't patient - she would often look annoyed or scold at students who answered incorrectly. Not really who you want for a beginner's language course. Also runs through material quickly, but you will learn a lot.

She's the best ARB1911 prof in uOttawa. She teaches so well and explains amazing. I wish there were more classes I can take with her. You should give preference to her over any other prof teaching the course.

Very good prof if your interested in the class. She can be somewhat repetitive in her lectures but she really just wants to make sure everyone undertands clearly. The class is tough but all language classes are, she really helped me learn the basics of arabic. She answers all questions clearly and will help you with anything.
Really easy class. Final exam was a joke. I spent only an hour a week studying for this class and came out with an A+.As a prof, she's pretty good I guess.
Mrs. Claude Rachid is an amazing teacher. She's nice and she is really patient to those who show true interest in learning the language. :)
